revisionDesc.change: moved notes to external notes file and added ptrs; checked
Proofreading Corrections: Heyde dates and Silent Proof
Moved RMBucke to HandNote; fixed editor, date, and title; reviewed paragraphing
Replaced smart quotes with straight; removed external URL links.
Changed straight quotes to chararacter reference smart quotes.

Corrected based on proofreading. Established year of letter based on Martha Mitchell Whitman's visit and Davis's plans to travel to Lowell, MA, corroborated in Martha Whitman letter of 27 February 1870 to Walt.
Noted image cut-offs. Changed "you" to "your" in line 8 on page 2 to reflect MS spelling.

body.p:
i have just got your letter and was glad to hear from you and received the papers on saturday) Saturday) dont don't be frightend frightened but Jeff and matty is both here matty has been here a week to day today Jeff had to come to pittsburgh Pittsburgh and stay a day or two and matt came on from there alone she is better than i expected to see her they left the children at home with her girl and davis Jeffy is going back next week as davis has got an appointment at lowel Lowell and Jeff has come on but has to return before davis leaves) but matty will return by the way off of washington Washington sure about the 9th or 10th of march March
i will write particular the day before she comes george will be home on saturday Saturday the weather has been extremely cold i am pretty well only lame as usual) walt get your new cloths clothes done if you can before matt comes she will come week after next certain) has mrs benedict a room she could accomadate accommodate her with for a few days she will visit the masons and mrs Oconor)

postscript.p: matty says she feels better than she did before she came from home Jeff is floureshing flourishing
